page.title: 10TOURISM NEW FOREST SEASIDE
page.content: All year round{tourists}come to Fern- down on holiday, but particularly in the summer months. Some of the main attractions are the{Golf Club,}the nearby{seaside}and the{New Forest.} The Golf Club attracts many people as annual international tournaments are held there. The beaches at{Boscombe and{Bournemouth}are wide and sandy, with safe bathing. They are packed throughout the summer and even some hardy people go for a daily swim in the winter. The New Forest covers a large area of approximately 78,000 hectares. It is the home of the New Forest{ponies}and various kinds of{deer.}The public are welcome, especially when they look after the environment. Many camp sites are provided. The forest was named the New Forest in the time of{King William {the Conqueror.
